title.narrative: The Australian Water Partnership (AWP) - Pakistan Water Diagnostic and Roadmap

description.narrative: The Australian Water Partnership (AWP) – Pakistan Water Diagnostic and Roadmap project (25 October 2019 to 31 December 2020) will focus on three activities for urban water challenges in Pakistan: i) a situation analysis and diagnostic for the Provinces of Sindh and Punjab; ii) development of a practical roadmap for improved water-related investment, management and use; and iii) presentation of the roadmap to stakeholders in Pakistan. The situation analysis will determine current and emerging urban water challenges and identify key issues and opportunities for improved water management. The roadmaps for the Sindh and Punjab provinces will prioritise urban water-related investments and interventions. The project will help build a shared understanding among stakeholders of challenges and priorities in the urban water space. The total value of this investment is $715,300 expensed in 2019-20 financial year.
